all you really need to know is what partitions you need to make.  Keep in mind that you don't need a /home partition (I don't use it), nor do you need a swap partition if you have a descent amount of ram.
You really don't need the /home partition.
no you don't need a swap partition
You should be able to.  All you need is a / partition.  A /home partition will just back up your /home/ directory (ie music files etc) which you can manually back up do a cd or something (saves room)
also make sure you choose primary partition.
it will ask you somewhere in the set up.  It will auto detect windows and set up everything for you. ;)
